text: so what we did was we designed an
exercise it was very structured it was a
team-based exercise where each team of
about six students was divided more or
less arbitrarily by us into three sub
teams and each of those three sub teams
were asked to go get information about a
particular topic using a different
medium of getting that information so
one group had to just use Google which
of course comes very naturally to them a
second group were required to use a more
formal
information uh Source a a um Nexus Lexus
some kind of systematic information
database and the third was asked to go
visit a Baker Library professional and
get their advice and and be steered by
their advice to go get the information
they needed they had to go out get
information from three different sources
then come back together wrestle with the
contradictions in the different bits of
information that they had come up with
uh the sheer amount of information so
they had to work together to sort it out
to resolve differences to deal with
group dynamics who's being heard who's
not being heard and then ultimately to
agree on a a decision and a set of
recommendations from there I think it's
fair to say that all of them found that
to be a very worthwhile experience not
always easy uh but but certainly
worthwhile
